subdisciplines.name: Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation
subdisciplines.description: The study of the afterglow of the Big Bang, which provides key evidence for the standard model of cosmology.

subdisciplines.name: Large Scale Structure
subdisciplines.description: The study of the distribution of matter on the largest scales in the universe, and its relation to the cosmic microwave background.

subdisciplines.name: Dark Matter
subdisciplines.description: The study of the mysterious substance that is believed to make up most of the matter in the universe, based on gravitational effects on visible matter.

subdisciplines.name: Dark Energy
subdisciplines.description: The study of the mysterious force that is believed to be causing the accelerating expansion of the universe.

subdisciplines.name: Physical cosmology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the largest-scale structures and dynamics of the universe and is concerned with fundamental questions about its formation, evolution, and ultimate fate.

subdisciplines.name: Observational cosmology
subdisciplines.description: Deals with the observation and measurement of the universe's properties, including studies involving galaxies and the cosmic microwave background radiation.

subdisciplines.name: Theoretical cosmology
subdisciplines.description: Attempts to develop explanations or models of the universe's properties, origins, and evolution, primarily based on physics principles.
